trans-unit.source: Configures the ASP.NET trace service.
This class cannot be inherited.
The TraceSection class provides a way to programmatically access and modify the content of the configuration file `trace` section.
The trace section configures the ASP.NET trace functionality and controls how trace results are gathered, stored, and displayed.
When tracing is enabled, each page request generates trace messages that can be appended to the page output or stored in an application trace log.
You can use the ASP.NET trace viewer (Trace.axd) to view the contents of the trace log.
> [!NOTE] > The element is allowed in the section of the configuration hierarchy in the Machine.config file and the Web.config files.
It is not allowed in configuration files of Web subdirectories.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.TraceSection"></xref> class using default settings.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ASP.NET trace service is enabled.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if trace is enabled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ASP.NET trace viewer (Trace.axd) is available only to requests from the host Web server.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the ASP.NET trace viewer (Trace.axd) is available only to requests from the host Web server; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the most recent requests are always stored on the server.
Requests are stored in the trace log in the order they arrive, up to the number of requests specified in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TraceSection.RequestLimit%2A> property.
When the request limit is reached and MostRecent is `true`, older requests are automatically discarded and new requests continue to be added to the log.
When the request limit is reached and MostRecent is `false`, new requests are discarded until earlier requests are removed from the log or the request limit is increased.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the most recent requests are always stored in the trace log; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is<xref uid="langword_csharp_ false" name=" false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ASP.NET trace information is appended to the output of each page.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the trace information is appended to each page; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value indicating the maximum number of requests to the application for which ASP.NET stores trace information.
The maximum request limit is 10,000.
If a value greater than 10,000 is specified, it is silently rounded down to 10,000 by ASP.NET.

The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TraceSection.MostRecent%2A> property gets or sets a value that determines whether the requests stored on the server are the most recent requests or the first requests to arrive.
**Note** When the number of requests exceeds the limit imposed by this setting and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TraceSection.MostRecent%2A> is `false`, no more requests are stored in the trace log.
If <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TraceSection.MostRecent%2A> is `true`, the most recent requests are stored up to the limit imposed by this setting and older requests are discarded.
The maximum number of requests to store on the server.
The default is 10.
Gets or sets the order in which ASP.NET trace information is displayed.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.TraceDisplayMode"></xref> values, indicating the order in which trace information is displayed.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the messages emitted through the page trace are forwarded to an instance of the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.Trace"></xref> class.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the trace messages are sent to the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.Trace"></xref> class; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is<xref uid="langword_csharp_ false" name=" false" href=""></xref>.
